election_record.label: New Hampshire 1790 President, Ballot 2

overview.note: No candidate had achieved a majority of the general election, forcing the legislature to elect a President.

"The Hon. House of Representatives on Friday sent up to the Hon. Senate, the names of the Hon. John Pickering and Josiah Bartlett, Esquires as candidates for the Presidency, the Senate proceeded to ballot, the Hon. Josiah Bartlett, Esq. had 6 votes, and the Hon. John Pickering, Esq. 5, therefore the Hon. Josiah Bartlett, Esq. is elected President of this State for the year ensuing." The New-Hampshire Gazette, and the General Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH). June 10, 1790.

election_record.reference: The New-Hampshire Gazette, and the General Advertiser (Portsmouth, NH). June 10, 1790.
